Module Simulator
Package kin.invkin.downhill

Class InverseKinematicsIterativeWithStandServo

java.lang.Object
kin.invkin.downhill.InverseKinematicsIterative
kin.invkin.downhill.InverseKinematicsIterativeWithStandServo
All Implemented Interfaces:
InverseKinematics
public class InverseKinematicsIterativeWithStandServo
extends InverseKinematicsIterative
Inverse kinematics computations based on iterative approximation (downhill approach). This approach is useful for arbitrary manipulator configurations for which no closed solution exist.
This specific subclass assumes a stand servo that determines a rotated plane of possible positions. As a result, the stand servo's angle simply is computed by arctan2 and the remaining problem is a 2D-problem. Thus, the computed stand servo's angle is defined as initial value of the downhill approach with delta value of zero. Actually, this servo angle is not considered as free variable of the downhill approach.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)
